oneLineSummary: This article explains data classes in Kotlin and their advantages compared to regular classes.
summary: In this article, the author explains data classes in Kotlin and highlights their advantages over regular classes. The author discusses the syntax and features of data classes, such as automatically generated methods like equals(), hashCode(), and toString(). The author also explains how data classes can be used for destructuring declarations and provides examples of copy() and component functions. Overall, the article provides a comprehensive overview of data classes in Kotlin.
